Our bandages Made in USA with globally sourced materials Not made with natural rubber latex Helps prevent infection Sterile Why do we love what we do? Our products are designed with the latest science and market-leading technologies so you can care for yourself & your loved ones with confidence and peace of mind. Live your life to the fullest knowing that should you get a cut or scrape along the way Care Science products will be there for you. About us Care Science products are manufactured by the US-based global leader in consumer first aid products.Established in 1988Headquarters and primary manufacturing site in Sarasota, Florida. What makes our product unqiue? Our mission is to provide innovative products, with superior features to competing brands, at highly competitive prices. We invest in developing superior products, not advertising budgets, and pass those savings on to you the customer.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good Staple For Your Medicine Cabinet
reviews.reviewText: Allow me to weave a nocturnal tale of the Care Science Fabric Adhesive Bandages, the silent guardians of my immortal existence in the realm of first aid. These bandages, much like the shadows that cloak my nocturnal ventures, have proven to be an essential staple in any first aid kit.In the cloak of darkness, when injuries befall the mortal coil, these fabric bandages emerge as reliable protectors. They adhere seamlessly to the skin, creating a fortress against the night's trials and tribulations. The secure adhesion is akin to the bond between night and the creatures that dwell within its mysterious embrace.The variety of sizes provided in this bandage arsenal is like a treasure trove of options for the discerning nocturnal healer. From the modest wounds to the more substantial injuries that demand attention, these bandages offer a selection that caters to the diverse needs of the shadows. Much like the array of blood types that flow through mortal veins, these bandages come in various sizes to suit every injury.As the night unfolds its mysteries, so do these fabric bandages reveal their versatility. Whether it's a minor cut that needs a discreet cover or a more substantial injury requiring a larger embrace, these bandages adapt to the needs of the moment. They're the unsung heroes that provide comfort and protection when the mortal coil faces the inevitable scratches and abrasions.In the silent hours of the night, when wounds need tending, the Care Science Fabric Adhesive Bandages emerge as the companions that every nocturnal healer desires. A worthy addition to any first aid kit, these bandages offer reliable adhesion, a variety of sizes, and the versatility to handle the shadows' unpredictable challenges. A must-have for those who tend to the wounds that go bump in the night.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars fabric adhesive bandages
reviews.reviewText: My favorite bandaids are the fabric kind because I can stick the adhesive of one end to the adhesive of the other and leave just a bit of adhesive backing to attach the end of the bandaid to me.And the fabric bandaids were the only ones that stayed through washing and getting wet.I also love that the fabric completely surrounds the cotton pad so that if the cut bleeds, it does not stain clothing.Very impressedItem was shipped without delay in perfect condition with no shipping logistics issues.

reviews.reviewText: These seem to hold up well over time.

reviews.reviewText: I like having assorted sizes on hand! They stay put even after getting wet. The price is very reasonable as well!

Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars They are better than some; they do stay on overnight!
reviews.reviewText: I always ordered a different bandaid from Amazon, that was great! However I couldn't find them this time when I ordered more bandaids. This "new" brand is okay, but it ravels, and I can't change them without them raveling or getting loose after they have been in water.I was able to do dishes, and still have the other bandaids stay on!
